response.answer_text: In modern-day context, the five southern states of Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana are together referred to as Dravida Naadu. However, if we travel back in history, we will find that Dravida Naadu is a different entity. During the times of Mahabharatha and Vedas, it was a region outside Chera, Chola, Pandya kingdom. So therefore it can’t include modern-day Tamil Nadu and Kerala. During the medieval age, it refers to the regions occupied by Pancha Dravidas - the brahmanas who lived south of Vindya mountains. Original Dravid were the original habitats of India when the Aryan started coming in Northern India. Dravid went to the southern part of India and it become the dravida Nadu. The main States Andhra Pradesh Tamil Nadu Kerala Karnataka are the main part of dravida Nadu.
